title.narrative: Togo - Financial Sector and Governance Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Financial Sector and Governance Project for Togo is to improve financial sector stability by supporting the Government financial sector reform program. The restructuring will lead to more efficient resource allocation towards poverty reducing and growth inducing sectors. The focus of the restructured project is to accelerate the restructuring of the banking sector, strengthen microfinance industry and the pension sector. After a thorough review of the resources available for the two first components (banking restructuring and microfinance sector) and taking into account ongoing and projected activities, there is no need for additional resources in those components to achieve the project development objective (PDO). In contrast, more resources are needed to fully achieve the PDO in components three (pension sector reforms) and component four (support to the implementation of reforms in financial and private sectors), as well as the project implementation unit.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :V.B | Description :The recipient shall recruit the privatization advisers for the 4 state owned banks | Due Date:31-Dec-2009
Finance Agreement :V.C | Description :the recipient shall prepare and submit a report prior to mid term review | Due Date:30-Apr-2012
Finance Agreement :V.C. | Description :Necessary draft laws and regulations for agency in charge of loan recovery prepared | DueDate :31-Dec-2010

title.narrative: BTCI and UTB meet liquidity norm by 2009 and every year until the end of the project
At least one recommendations of the Corporate governance Assessment is implemented within 6 months following the validation workshop
The parameters reform CRT have been adjusted through decree according to the findings of the actuarial study by 2016
The legal frameworks for CRT is modified according to established best practices by 2016 (in particular, parameters for contribution and payments are established through decrees)
BTCI and UTB have new gross NPLs below 5 percent of total loans each year (starting in 2009)
Percentage of MFIs (with outstanding loans over 1 billion CFAF) meet key prudential ratio (liquidity ratio and long-medium term asset/liability ratios) by end of project

baseline.value: (No prudential ratios yet defined by BCEAO)

title.narrative: Project direct beneficiaries of which female
At least 75 percent of MFIs transmit statistical data in compliance with new accounting plan
At least 75 percent of MFIs (with outstanding loans over 1 billion CFAF) have undergone at least one transparency exercise between 2009 and 2016.
At least 75 percent of MFIs (with outstanding loans over 1 billion CFAF) have gross a Portfolio at Risk over 90 days (PAR>90) below5 percent by the end of the project
All MFIs with outstanding loans over 1 billion CFAF report their financial information on the Mix Market (www.mixmarket.org) starting in 2009
Reform Secretariat is operational and demonstrates the ability to identify and steer key reforms in the financial and private sectors
CASIMEC adopts a code of ethics by the end of the project
BTCI and UTB meet key prudential norms (solvency) by 2009 and every year until the end of the project

actual.value: Not achieved for UTB and BTCI

title.narrative: Two out of the four targeted banks (BTCI, UTB, BIA , UTB) have entered into partnerships with strategic banking investors by June 2010, the third bank, by 2012
The parameters for CNSS have been adjusted through decrees according to the findings of the actuarial studies by 2011
After the recapitalization of Togolese commercial banks (BTCI, UTB and BIA), the Government will no longer contribute to the absorpt ion of losses, recapitalization and liquidity of commercial banks.
The agency in charge of loan recovery and of creating a secondary market for government securities is created by end 2009 and operational from 2013
The legal frameworks for CNSS is modified according to established best practices by 2011 (in particular, parameters for contribution and payments are established through decrees)
All MFIs with outstanding loans over 1 billion CFAF) have their financial statements audited and certified yearly by BCEAO registered auditors
Volume of Bank Support: Institutional Development - Microfinance
